  • havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_sanity_check.openbmc_sanity_check

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_sanity_check.openbmc_sanity_check

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
import havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.fanspeedcheck as fanspeed


[docs]class OpenbmcSanityCheck(TestBase):


[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the OpenBMC Sanity Check test")

        # Read the OpenBMC MAC address
        self.get_openbmc_mac_addr()

        if not self.host.oob.is_wedge():
            if not self.host.oob_only:
                # Get GUID
                self.get_guid()

            # Verify if Fan Speed can be modified and read correctly.
            self.sanity_check_fan_speed()

            # Verify the battery volts
            self.get_battery_volts()

            # Get the FAN Speed from sensor-util date
            self.get_fan_rpm_from_sensor_data()

            # Run specific OpenBMC command
            self.run_openbmccmd()
        else:
            self.validate_condition(True, "Skipping additional checks on Wedge")



[docs]    def run_openbmccmd(self):
        self.host.oob.log_message()



[docs]    def get_openbmc_mac_addr(self):
        self.log_info("Get OpenBMC MAC Address")
        out = self.host.oob.get_openbmc_mac()
        self.validate_condition(out,
                "OpenBMC MAC Address %s" % (out))



[docs]    def get_guid(self):
        self.log_info("Get GUID")
        out = self.host.run("ipmitool raw 0x06 0x08")

        match = re.search("Unable to send RAW command", out)
        self.validate_condition(match != "Unable to send RAW command",
            "OpenBMC GUID %s" % (out)
        )



[docs]    def sanity_check_fan_speed(self):
        self.log_info("Verify if the Fan Speed can be changed")
        out = fanspeed.verify_fan_speed(self, self.host)
        self.validate_condition(out, "Fan Speed Changed = %s" % (out))



[docs]    def get_battery_volts(self):
        self.log_info("Verify Battery Volts using Sensor Data")

        out = self.host.oob.sensor_data()

        # Check if the Battery volts is high enough
        match = re.search(r"PV_BAT\s+\(0xD7\)\s+:\s+([\d+]\.[\d+][\d+])", out)

        if match:
            self.validate_condition(float(match.group(1)) >= 3.00,
                "Validate Battery Volts is above threshold 3.00 : Found %f" %
                float(match.group(1)))
        else:
            raise TestError("Failed to get Battery volts")



[docs]    def get_fan_rpm_from_sensor_data(self):
        self.log_info("Get Fan Speed from Sensor Util")
        out = self.host.oob.run_obmccmd("/usr/local/bin/sensor-util", "spb")

        # Get the Fan0 Speed from sensor output
        match = re.search(r"FAN0\w+\s+\(0x46\)\s+:\s+(\w+.\w+\s+\w+)", out)
        if match:
            fan0 = match.group(1)
            self.log_info("Fan0 RPM (%s)" % (fan0))
        else:
            raise TestError("FAILED to get FAN 0 Speed")

        # Get the Fan1 Speed from sensor output
        match = re.search(r"FAN1\w+\s+\(0x47\)\s+:\s+(\w+.\w+\s+\w+)", out)
        if match:
            fan1 = match.group(1)
            self.log_info("Fan1 RPM (%s)" % (fan1))
        else:
            raise TestError("FAILED to get FAN 1 Speed")



[docs]def main():
    test = OpenbmcSanityCheck()
    test.lifecycle()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
